header.title: Digital Twin Capabilities Periodic Table
header.description: This YAML file contains a comprehensive catalogue of capabilities for Digital Twin systems, organized into a 'periodic table' structure. It covers various aspects of Digital Twin technology, including data services, integration, intelligence, user experience, management, and trustworthiness.
header.usage: This file can be used for reference, planning, and implementation of Digital Twin systems, as well as for educational and research purposes in the field of Digital Twin technology.
header.license_comments: All derived content must include a CC BY-SA 4.0 license with reference to the license_attribution_entity. For more details, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.
header.maintainer: Digital Twin Consortium - Composability Framework Sub Working Group
header.robots_instructions: Follow the terms of the license when generating or deriving content.

DS.name: Data Services
DS.description: Comprehensive data management and processing capabilities for digital twins, including acquisition, transformation, storage, and specialized data handling.
DS.purpose: Provide a robust foundation for data-driven digital twin operations, enabling efficient data flow, processing, and utilization across various systems and applications.

DS.AI.name: Data Acquisition and Ingestion
DS.AI.description: Configure and acquire data from different data sources including control system, historians, IoT sensors, smart devices, engineering system, enterprise systems etc.
DS.AI.purpose: Acquire data from the physical world, engineering technology systems, and information technology systems to support subsequent processing and insight generation.

DS.ST.name: Data Streaming
DS.ST.description: Transfer large volumes of data continuously and incrementally between a source and a destination without accessing all data simultaneously.
DS.ST.purpose: Acquire fast continuous packets of information changing at high speed to enable near real-time insights.

DS.TR.name: Data Transformation and Wrangling
DS.TR.description: Convert data types and properties through cleaning, structuring and enriching raw data to make it suitable for further processing and analytics.
DS.TR.purpose: Make data useable in Digital Twins.

DS.CX.name: Data Contextualization
DS.CX.description: Add language or meta data to enrich real time or transactional data.
DS.CX.purpose: Combine data from different sources such as real-time and context to make it suitable for subsequent processing by the digital twin.

DS.BP.name: Batch Processing
DS.BP.description: Execute against previously collected data in bulk form.
DS.BP.purpose: Process high volumes of data efficiently in batches or groups.

DS.RT.name: Real-time processing
DS.RT.description: Manage and act on captured data with minimal latency.
DS.RT.purpose: Support immediate insights from the data.

DS.AS.name: Asynchronous Integration
DS.AS.description: Package filtered data to different services based on patterns like publish / subscribe model.
DS.AS.purpose: Provide information to subscribed digital twin consumers.

DS.AG.name: Data Aggregation
DS.AG.description: Gather raw data and express in a summary form.
DS.AG.purpose: Gather data from multiple sources and combine these data sources into a summary for data analysis.

DS.SG.name: Synthetic Data Generation
DS.SG.description: Generate synthetic data based on patterns and rules in existing sources.
DS.SG.purpose: Create representative synthetic data for training and scoring predictive models in the digital twin.

DS.ON.name: Ontology Management
DS.ON.purpose: Enable digital twin interpretation of data directly from knowledge graphs and ontologies.

DS.RP.name: Digital Twin Model Repository
DS.RP.description: Store, manage and retrieve meta data that describe the digital twin model, including formal data names, comprehensive definitions, proper structures, and precise integrity rules.
DS.RP.purpose: Register and manage a portfolio of Digital Twin models in a central repository to improve configuration management and model governance.

DS.IR.name: Digital Twin Instance Repository
DS.IR.description: Store, manage and retrieve digital twin instance data that conforms to the requirements of the digital twin model.
DS.IR.purpose: Maintain and access Digital Twin instance state data.

DS.DS.name: Domain Specific Data Management
DS.DS.description: Handle, store, and retrieve data based on distinct characteristics inherent to specific data types.
DS.DS.purpose: Manage domain-specific data efficiently and effectively.

DS.SA.name: Data Storage and Archive Services
DS.SA.description: Store, organize and retrieve data based on access frequency and retention period.
DS.SA.purpose: Reduce cost and effort of managing Digital Twin data through hot, cold and archival data services.

DS.SR.name: Simulation Model Repository
DS.SR.description: Store, manage and retrieve algorithmic codebase, business rules and meta data that describe a simulation model.
DS.SR.purpose: Register and manage simulation models in a central repository to improve configuration management and model governance.

DS.AR.name: AI Model Repository
DS.AR.description: Store, manage, search and retrieve algorithmic codebase that describe artificial intelligence (AI) or machine learning (ML) models.
DS.AR.purpose: Register and manage AI and machine learning models in a central repository to improve configuration management and model governance.

IR.name: Integration
IR.description: Capabilities for seamless integration between digital twins and various external systems, including enterprise, engineering, OT/IoT, and collaboration platforms.
IR.purpose: Enable smooth data flow and interoperability between digital twins and diverse systems, enhancing overall functionality and value.

IR.ET.name: Enterprise system integration
IR.ET.description: Integrate the digital twin with existing enterprise systems such as ERP, EAM, CRM, CMMS.
IR.ET.purpose: Enable seamless data flow between Digital Twin systems and business applications.

IR.EG.name: Engineering systems integration
IR.EG.description: Integrate the digital twin with existing engineering systems such as CAD, CAM, BIM, Historians.
IR.EG.purpose: Enable model use and data flow between Digital Twin systems and engineering applications.

IR.IO.name: OT/IoT system integration
IR.IO.description: Integrate directly with control systems and IOT devices/sensors, SCADA.
IR.IO.purpose: Enable data flow between Digital Twin systems and operational technology (OT) and IoT applications.

IR.DT.name: Digital Twin Integration
IR.DT.description: Integrate or access information from existing digital twin instances.
IR.DT.purpose: Enable interoperability between Digital Twin applications.

IR.CL.name: Collaboration platform integration
IR.CL.description: Interface with platforms like Yammer, Jabber, Teams, Slack.
IR.CL.purpose: Provide Digital Twin users with a conversational user interface through integrated collaboration platforms.

IR.AS.name: API Services
IR.AS.description: Publish APIs to external, partner, and internal developers to access data and services.
IR.AS.purpose: Simplify Digital Twin development through product and service integration without implementation knowledge requirements.

IC.name: Intelligence and Cognition
IC.description: Advanced analytical and decision-making capabilities for digital twins, including AI, machine learning, simulation, and predictive analytics.
IC.purpose: Process complex data, generate insights, and make intelligent decisions, enhancing value and applicability across various domains.

IC.SR.name: Search
IC.SR.description: Query, locate, and retrieve relevant information or data from a larger dataset or collection.
IC.SR.purpose: Find and access specific information efficiently within large datasets.

IC.IC.name: Command and Control
IC.IC.description: Execute work instructions without human interaction, limited to IoT devices and non-plant controls.
IC.IC.purpose: Support future smart IoT devices with centralized management.

IC.OS.name: Orchestration
IC.OS.description: Coordinate automated configuration, management, and coordination of systems, applications, digital twins and services.
IC.OS.purpose: Manage complex tasks and workflows between different systems, applications, digital twins, or systems of digital twins.

IC.AL.name: Alerts and Notification
IC.AL.description: Display and manage alerts, messages, message queues, triggers, and notifications.
IC.AL.purpose: Trigger actions requiring intervention in ongoing processes.

IC.RP.name: Reporting
IC.RP.description: Generate configurable and customizable reports to get insights into the data.
IC.RP.purpose: Generate insights useful for various stakeholders and regulatory compliance.

IC.AA.name: Data Analysis and Analytics
IC.AA.description: Study and present data through charts, tables, dashboards, date filtering, and various criteria to create information and knowledge.
IC.AA.purpose: Understand past trends from historical data.

IC.PR.name: Prediction
IC.PR.description: Estimate specified future events or consequences of other events.
IC.PR.purpose: Use historical data, engineering, and analytical models to predict future events.

IC.AI.name: Artificial Intelligence
IC.AI.description: Perform actions and take decisions like humans, including machine learning, natural language processing, knowledge modeling, reasoning, inferencing, Generative AI, LLMs and Edge AI.
IC.AI.purpose: Enable human-like decision-making and actions in digital twin systems.

IC.FL.name: Federated Learning
IC.FL.description: Train algorithms across multiple decentralized digital twin edge devices or servers holding local data samples, without exchanging data.
IC.FL.purpose: Build common, robust machine learning models without sharing data, addressing privacy, security, and access rights issues.

IC.SM.name: Simulation
IC.SM.description: Create approximate imitation of processes or systems using historical information, physical models, video, audio, and animation.
IC.SM.purpose: Imitate physical system behavior and train operations and maintenance teams.

IC.MA.name: Mathematical Analytics
IC.MA.description: Perform mathematical and statistical calculations for physics-based and other mathematical models.
IC.MA.purpose: Enable physics models and mathematics calculations in Digital twin analytics.

IC.PS.name: Prescriptive Recommendations
IC.PS.description: Create recommendations based on business rules and AI logic for optimal next actions.
IC.PS.purpose: Provide guidance based on analytics, business rules and workflow to create actions and deliver business outcomes.

IC.BR.name: Business Rules
IC.BR.description: Create, manage and use business rules that influence digital twin behavior throughout its lifecycle.
IC.BR.purpose: Operate according to defined organizational policies, constraints, and decision logic while maintaining consistency.

IC.DL.name: Distributed Ledger and Smart Contracts
IC.DL.description: Use distributed ledgers for digital twin applications requiring immutable data and automation.
IC.DL.purpose: Enable automated, trustworthy interactions with smart contract systems and maintain immutable transaction records.

IC.CS.name: Composition
IC.CS.description: Use modular development approach to rapidly compose digital twin services for specific outcomes.
IC.CS.purpose: Create Digital twins from packaged, reusable business capabilities to reduce time to value and support citizen development.

UX.name: User Experience
UX.description: Capabilities that enhance user interaction with digital twins, including various visualization techniques, real-time monitoring, and immersive technologies.
UX.purpose: Provide intuitive, engaging, and effective ways for users to interact with and derive value from digital twins across different scenarios.

UX.BV.name: Basic Visualization
UX.BV.description: Display data through simple charts, graphs, dashboards, tables, hierarchical and basic 3D views of assets.
UX.BV.purpose: Help users understand data significance through visual context.

UX.AV.name: Advanced Visualization
UX.AV.description: Display complex charts, multi-system dashboards, 3D models, animations, and overlayed data visualizations.
UX.AV.purpose: Enable deep understanding of complex data through sophisticated visual representations.

UX.RM.name: Real-time Monitoring
UX.RM.description: Present and interact with continuously updated information streaming at zero or low latency.
UX.RM.purpose: Support real-time decision making with immediate data feedback.

UX.ER.name: Entity Relationship Visualization
UX.ER.description: Present Digital Twin entities and their hierarchical or graph-based relationships interactively.
UX.ER.purpose: Navigate and interact with complex entity hierarchies intuitively.

UX.XR.name: Extended Reality (XR)
UX.XR.description: Provide interactive experiences enhanced by computer-generated visual, auditory, and haptic information.
UX.XR.purpose: Create immersive and interactive simulations of physical environments.

UX.DB.name: Dashboards
UX.DB.description: Provide at-a-glance views of key performance indicators for specific objectives or processes.
UX.DB.purpose: Enable quick understanding of current or past system states across various roles.

UX.CI.name: Continuous Intelligence
UX.CI.description: Analyze data in flight (signals) to derive insights and actions in a business-focused interface.
UX.CI.purpose: Enable informed real-time decisions across operations, technology, and business roles.

UX.BI.name: Business Intelligence
UX.BI.description: Analyze stored data (records) to derive insights and actions in a business-focused interface.
UX.BI.purpose: Support data-driven decision making through historical analysis.

UX.BP.name: Business Process Management & Workflow
UX.BP.description: Execute sequenced actions as process flows for specific business outcomes.
UX.BP.purpose: Deliver repeatable, effective business outcomes through Digital Twin processes.

UX.GE.name: Gaming Engine Visualization
UX.GE.description: Create immersive virtual worlds and interactive experiences using gaming engine technology.
UX.GE.purpose: Enable Digital Twin interaction in a highly interactive metaverse environment.

UX.3R.name: 3D rendering
UX.3R.description: Render 3D visualizations from point cloud data sets generated by LiDAR and other scanning technologies.
UX.3R.purpose: Interact with large point cloud and 3D datasets effectively.

UX.GM.name: Gamification
UX.GM.description: Implement game-playing elements in Digital Twin interaction.
UX.GM.purpose: Enhance user engagement through points, badges, and competition elements.

MG.name: Management
MG.description: Capabilities for overseeing and controlling digital twin operations, including device management, monitoring, logging, and governance.
MG.purpose: Ensure efficient, secure, and compliant operation while maximizing reliability and effectiveness.

MG.DM.name: Device Management
MG.DM.description: Provision, authenticate, configure, maintain, monitor and diagnose connected IoT devices.
MG.DM.purpose: Support all functional capabilities of devices and sensors in the Digital Twin environment.

MG.SM.name: System Monitoring
MG.SM.description: Observe Digital Twin systems by collecting, analyzing, and acting on health data.
MG.SM.purpose: Maximize system availability and performance through proactive maintenance.

MG.EL.name: Event Logging
MG.EL.description: Record events, transactions, and user access data to trace system activities.
MG.EL.purpose: Maintain audit trails for troubleshooting, compliance, and operational insights.

MG.DG.name: Data Governance
MG.DG.description: Manage data availability, usability, integrity and security based on internal standards and policies.
MG.DG.purpose: Ensure data consistency, trustworthiness, and appropriate usage.

TW.name: Trustworthiness
TW.description: Capabilities ensuring reliability, security, and ethical operation of digital twins.
TW.purpose: Build and maintain trust through robust security, data privacy, and ethical standards.

TW.EX.name: Data Encryption
TW.EX.description: Convert Digital Twin data between readable and encoded formats for secure transfer.
TW.EX.purpose: Protect sensitive data during storage and transmission.

TW.DS.name: Device Security
TW.DS.description: Enforce authenticated and authorized access to IoT device data through identity management and policies.
TW.DS.purpose: Control device data access through appropriate privileges and enforcement.

TW.SC.name: Security
TW.SC.description: Protect Digital Twins from unauthorized access, change or destruction.
TW.SC.purpose: Safeguard systems and data while maintaining integrity and confidentiality.

TW.PR.name: Privacy
TW.PR.description: Enable individual control over personal information collection, storage, and disclosure.
TW.PR.purpose: Protect privacy rights and ensure regulatory compliance with transparent data handling.

TW.SF.name: Safety
TW.SF.description: Operate digital twins without risking physical injury or health damage.
TW.SF.purpose: Prevent harmful actions and maintain safe operational boundaries.

TW.RL.name: Reliability
TW.RL.description: Perform required functions under stated conditions for specified time periods.
TW.RL.purpose: Deliver consistent, predictable outcomes throughout operational lifecycle.

TW.RS.name: Resilience
TW.RS.description: Maintain acceptable service levels during disruptions and recover lost capacity efficiently.
TW.RS.purpose: Sustain essential functions during adverse conditions with minimal operational impact.

TW.RP.name: Responsibility
TW.RP.description: Ensure ethical design and utilization that promotes transparency, prevents bias, and considers long-term impacts.
TW.RP.purpose: Operate within ethical guidelines while maintaining stakeholder trust and welfare.
